other_tests.findings: Case 1: Absolute eosinophil count of 10.9 × 10^9/L; Case 2: Absolute eosinophil count of 5.2 × 10^9/L; Case 5: Absolute eosinophil count of 4.7 × 10^9/L.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Case 1: Eosinophil count increased from 0.09 × 10^9/L two years prior to 10.9 × 10^9/L; Case 2: Normal CBC two years prior showed no eosinophilia before 5.2 × 10^9/L; Case 5: Eosinophil count increased from 0.1 × 10^9/L three years prior to 4.7 × 10^9/L.

other_tests.findings: High numbers of D. fragilis identified in cases 1, 2, and 5. Case 4 had negative stool microscopy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Case 1: Revealed D. fragilis; 40 days after treatment, case 5 showed D. fragilis presence; case 4 remained asymptomatic despite positive PCR.

other_tests.findings: All patients with gastrointestinal symptoms or eosinophilia confirmed positive for D. fragilis.
